topic: quopri: common mistakes, gotchas, and best practices (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: quopri: common mistakes, gotchas, and best practices (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Quopri Module in Python 3.12+: Best Practices, Gotchas, and Common Mistakes
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an overview of the Quopri module in Python 3.12+, focusing on common mistakes, best practices, and potential pitfalls to ensure successful implementation.
key_points: Understand the purpose and functionality of the Quopri module for handling MIME encodings
Be aware that Quopri is a part of the standard library since Python 3.7
Learn about encoding and decoding techniques with Quopri functions
Grasp the difference between raw and base64 encoded data in Quopri

code_examples.code:
import quopri
encoded = quopri.encodestring('Hello, World!').decode('ascii')
print(encoded)

version_notes: Quopri is a part of the standard library since Python 3.7, and improvements may be made in later versions such as Python 3.12.
Ensure your Python environment supports at least version 3.12 to leverage the latest features.
caveats: Always remember to handle binary data appropriately, and ensure that you decode byte strings when necessary
Be mindful of the character set and encoding used when working with Quopri
Avoid using deprecated functions or methods in favor of more modern alternatives
